Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a stochastic process

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: when you first start it its 0...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it needs to get to the same number as the other nodes on all dpow coins before they reach consesnus at the same time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like tossing a coin, sometimes you get 4 heads in a row and almost never do you get heads and tails alternating for dozens of turns

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you do get perfectly alternating heads and tails, after a while you can prove it is not a randomized process

Author: Alright#0419
Content: what is the coin toss? when you start iguana?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or each notarization?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notarization participation

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`Somtimes one of them wont ntoarize for days even weeks.`
But those are stagnant, on-demand chains, no?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, no block means no notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the bestmask selector moves around the 64 bits every 64 notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or i guess with less NN, every N notarizations where N is the number of notaries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: minsigs are selected from the starting point based on availability of node and its connectivity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so given perfect conditions a node wont notarize for (N-minsigs) number of rounds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and given imperfect conditions of the peerr NN, it would be less than (N-minsigs) gaps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if your node is the one not connected to the other nodes, then you can miss out on many, so first thing to check is the recvmasks for the other peers

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if that is good, and you have utxo, it will notarize your share

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but not in any perfect predictable frequency

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to understand the iguana is to know the iguana

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the ones that are one with the iguana are few indeed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
BODY LANGUAGE OF THE GREEN IGUANA

Various things to notice: 

1) BODY POSTURE and MOVEMENT, 
2) EYES DIRECTION, EYE LID SHAPE and ACTIVITY, 
3) TONGUE ACTIVITY, 

There is a body language that iguanas have and it is of the utmost importance to learn it to properly read and understand what's on the iguana's mind, so you are able to accurately know it's every mood and attitude from moment to moment. You can tell if the iguana is calm and relaxed or scared and ready to run or ready to bite and whip instead or wants to have sex and mate or that he's suddenly taken on a scary change in character and become so serious and angry, and wants to go to war with you exactly as he would act if he sees another male iguana. 

When observing the iguana's body signs and activity, you must learn to distinguish between things that are temporary and changes of the moment as opposed to it's regular moods and behavior in general.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I hope I made my point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://www.todaysplanet.com/pg/beta/lizardlover/page3.htm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if 1/4 of recvmasks are 0, unless they are all consecutive, you will lose far more than 25% of notarizations

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
You should have the same recvmask as the rest of the nodes. 
The CURL sommand CrisF psoted, shows the info for the first dpow coin (which is BEER I think) and you want to check it only at the near end of a round so it has all teh required information received.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: `curl -s --url "http://127.0.0.1:7776" --data "{\"agent\":\"dpow\",\"method\":\"active\"}" | jq -c .[]`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I was ablet o test reaction of my node by callign that command in fast sucession, at the start of a round.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It helps to see who you see first

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If reccv mask is bad, you need to start scanning ports on other ndoes, and doing trace backs and tcpdumps and stuff... I thaught we fixed nearlyt all these problems though. 99% of the issue will be some nodes not updating with the new pubkeys.
